genre: active indie rock, garage rock, electro guitar, overdriven, arctic monkeys style, melodic energy, mid-tempo groove, urban indie, digital age rock

lines: (instrumental intro – driving melodic guitar riff, drums and bass gradually enter, setting a nocturnal, urban mood)
Streetlights paint the glass of every screen
Lost in a crowd, a silent, flickering scene
Thumb scrolls past a thousand faces I've never seen
Just a pixel ghost in this digital machine
Yeah, we're screaming into the void tonight
Chasing signals in the neon light
Lost in the echo of a forgotten sight
Are we ever really connecting right?
(short instrumental break – guitar lead plays off main riff, groove maintains intensity, slight dynamic shift)
Another notification, a phantom buzz
Empty conversations, 'cause that's all there was
Searching for a feeling in the electric fuzz
Wondering if real life is still calling us
Yeah, we're screaming into the void tonight
Chasing signals in the neon light
Lost in the echo of a forgotten sight
Are we ever really connecting right?
Is there a space beyond the blue-lit pane?
A hand to hold, to wash away the digital rain?
Or are we bound to this wired, endless chain?
(music slightly stripped down, more emotional delivery, builds subtly back up)
We're screaming into the void tonight
Chasing signals in the neon light
Lost in the echo of a forgotten sight
Are we ever really connecting right?
(extended instrumental outro – main guitar riff evolves, layered guitars, drums become more sparse, slow fade-out with atmospheric feedback)
